definitions.agreement: This Collective Agreement reached between the Employer and the Union
definitions.bargaining_unit: The unit for collective bargaining for which the B.C. Government and Service Employees' Union is certified by the Industrial Relations Council
definitions.basic_pay: The rate of pay negotiated by the parties to this Agreement, including add-to-pay resulting from salary protection
definitions.child: Deemed to include a ward of the Superintendent of Child Welfare, or a child of a spouse
definitions.complainant: A person who alleges that they have been harassed or discriminated against
definitions.coordinator: Title and language to be decided between the parties
definitions.continuous_employment: Uninterrupted employment as a regular or auxiliary employee with the Coast Mountain College and includes service in the Public Service of British Columbia for those employees employed by the Public Service of British Columbia at March 31, 1976 and melded to Coast Mountain College at April 1, 1976 as recognized at the time of the melding, subject to the provisions of Articles 11 and 33
definitions.continuous_service: Uninterrupted employment as a regular or auxiliary employee with the Coast Mountain College and includes service in the Public Service of British Columbia for those employees employed by the Public Service of British Columbia at March 31, 1976 and melded to Coast Mountain College at April 1, 1976 as recognized at the time of the melding, subject to the provisions of Articles 11 and 33
definitions.day_of_rest: In relation to an employee, means a day other than a holiday on which an employee is not ordinarily required to perform the duties of their position. This does not include employees on a leave of absence
definitions.demotion: A change from an employee's position to one with a lower maximum salary

employee.definition: A member of the bargaining unit
employee.regular_employee: An employee who is employed for work which is of a continuous full-time or continuous part-time nature; or who is employed for work which is of a continuous full-time nature and which is expected to last for a six (6) month period or longer
employee.recurring_seasonal_employee: An employee who is employed for work which is of a continuous full-time or continuous part-time nature for a defined period which is expected to last for a six (6) month period or longer and which normally recurs every academic year
employee.auxiliary_employee: An employee who is employed for work which is not of a continuous nature such as: seasonal positions; positions created to carry out special projects of work which is not continuous; and temporary positions created to cover employees on vacation, short-term disability leave, education leave, compassionate leave, or other leave
employee.exclusions: Employee does not include incumbents of managerial or confidential positions mutually excluded by the parties to this Agreement

definitions.headquarters: That area within a radius of thirty-two (32) kilometres of where an employee ordinarily performs their duties. When employees are relocated the headquarters area may be redefined where exceptional circumstances such as unusual road conditions exist
definitions.geographic_location: That area within a radius of thirty-two (32) kilometres of where an employee ordinarily performs their duties. When employees are relocated the headquarters area may be redefined where exceptional circumstances such as unusual road conditions exist
definitions.holiday: The twenty-four (24) hour period commencing at 0001 hours of a day designated as a paid holiday in this Agreement
definitions.hours_of_operation: The hours established by the Employer to provide adequate service to the public and to fulfil the functions of the work unit
definitions.hours_travelled: Hours spent travelling from point to point on an hourly or daily basis laid down by the Employer and does not include meal breaks, lodging time or time spent other than travelling
definitions.lateral_transfer: Refers to the movement of an employee from one position to another which does not constitute a demotion or promotion
definitions.transfer: Refers to the movement of an employee from one position to another which does not constitute a demotion or promotion
definitions.layoff: Includes a cessation of employment, resulting from elimination of a job, a reorganization, program termination, closure or other material change in organization
definitions.leave_of_absence_with_pay: To be absent from duty with permission and with pay
definitions.leave_of_absence_without_pay: To be absent from duty with permission but without pay
definitions.liaison_officer: An employee whose primary and principal duties are, through contact with business, industry and other various government agencies, the promotion, organization and development of customized and special programs throughout the College Region and for all purposes shall be considered a non-instructional employee
definitions.non_instructional_staff: All employees included in the Union's certification who are not instructors and includes Coordinators and Liaison Officers
definitions.parties: Coast Mountain College and the BCGEU, Local 712
definitions.post_secondary_employers_association: The Employers' Association established for post-secondary colleges and institutions under the Public Sector Employers' Act
definitions.psea: The Employers' Association established for post-secondary colleges and institutions under the Public Sector Employers' Act
definitions.probation: A period of sixty (60) workdays to which an employee is subject upon appointment or promotion during which time the Employer may reject the Employee for just cause. In the case of a promotion, should an employee be rejected during the probationary period, they shall revert to their former position at the same level they occupied prior to promotion. Upon successful completion of probation, the employee shall be confirmed in the position by the College
definitions.promotion: A change from an employee's position to one with a higher maximum salary level
definitions.relocation: Refers to the movement of an employee from one geographic location to another
definitions.resignation: A voluntary notice by the employee that they are terminating their service on the date specified
definitions.respondent: A person who is alleged to have engaged in harassment or discrimination
definitions.rest_period: A paid interval which is included in the workday and is intended to give the employee an opportunity to have refreshments or a rest
definitions.shift: The period of scheduled straight-time working hours on a scheduled workday

spouse.definition: A lawful husband or wife, or a person of the opposite sex living in a common-law relationship with the employee, or a person of the same sex as the employee and with whom the employee cohabited for a period of at least one (1) year
spouse.common_law_relationship: A common-law relationship will exist when, for a continuous period of at least one (1) year, an employee has lived with a person in a relationship of some permanence as a couple and intends to live with that person as a couple
spouse.same_sex_relationship: A person of the same sex as the employee and with whom the employee cohabited for a period of at least one (1) year and the employee and this person represent themselves as a couple
spouse.benefits_note: The College will accept same-gender spousal relationships for the purpose of benefits in those instances where there is no regulatory or other external impediment to the College's control. This definition shall apply to the following benefits: Medical Services Plan, Extended Health Plan, Dental Plan and the Basic Group Life Plan

definitions.termination: The separation of an employee from the College for cause pursuant to Articles 10, 11 or 33
definitions.travel_status: With respect to an employee means absence of the employee from their headquarters or geographic location on College business with the approval of the Employer
definitions.union: The B.C. Government and Service Employees' Union
definitions.workday: A period of twenty-four (24) consecutive hours commencing with the starting time of any shift. For the purpose of calculating compensatory overtime rates only, the time worked prior to, but adjoining to, a shift shall be deemed as time worked after a shift
definitions.work_schedule: The roster of work hours and days to meet the annual hours of work
